intro: Ceropegia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Ceropegia longiflora is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
